results.title: Film Ist
results.creator_credit: Gustav Deutsch, Manfred Neuwirth and LOOP TV-Video-Film
results.brief_description: Austrian filmmaker Gustav Deutsch is one of contemporary cinema’s pre-eminent avantgarde artists. After several years combing a massive archive of scientific films, Deutsch released ‘Film Ist (1-6)’, a film made up of found footage edited together into extraordinary assemblages of sound and image. The fragments of film traverse a vast range of human experimentation with time, light, motion, and the human form. We see vocal chords at work while we hear a singer rehearsing. As if peering into the suppressed memory of cinema itself, we see an eye being excised from the socket, the slow motion movement of apes, bullets, children and cats, and the world offered back to us as a phantasmagoria of wave forms, wind patterns, lightning flashes and electrical currents. Cinema was born out of scientific endeavour and has since redefined so much of how we understand the physical and temporal properties of the world. ‘Film Ist’ is a remarkable surrealistic report on cinema’s own memory of its mysterious role in the creation of the modern world.

results.title: Aerobicide
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audo
results.brief_description:
Set against a backdrop of a woman singing and the constant image of a woman’s legs in energetic cycling movements, a room full of men attempt to cultivate female
trends but are ultimately unsuccessful. The energy of the women in this short music clip, singing and exercising is a stark contrast to the inertia of the males around them.

results.title: Harvey
results.creator_credit: Peter McDonald, Priscilla Collins, Rachel Roberts and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A dark tale of obsession and loneliness about a man searching for physical and emotional completeness. It is only when he thinks he has achieved this goal through the unwilling coalescence of his neighbour that he begins to understand the painful, irresolvable nature of his obsession. Stars Nicholas Hope as Harvey and Lisa Angove as Lily.

results.title: Egg
results.creator_credit: Nicole Mitchell, Anne Gilhooly and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
An elderly woman living alone in her suburban family home makes a friend - a fallen bird’s egg she finds in the local park. She takes Egg into her home, and into her heart.
A sensual and evocative film about lonliness, life and love.
Features Paulette Perry as the woman.

results.title: That's showbiz
results.brief_description: A hilarious comedy which details the rise and fall of a failing outback vaudeville troupe which imports an infamous city striptease, Madame Lash, to enliven their act.

results.title: The Illustrated Auschwitz
results.creator_credit: Kathy Drayton, Lucia Salinas Briones, Jackie Farkas and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Jackie Farkas uses the extraordinary and harrowing oral testimony of an elderly Hungarian woman as the basis for a poetic and abstract investigation into how cinema can ‘illustrate’ such profoundly horrendous experiences. The use of found footage, elusive images of beauty and horror and sequences from ‘The Wizard of Oz’ to elucidate the narrator’s memories creates an extraordinary representation of the holocaust experience, of survival, of home and memory, and of how we can comprehend the incomprehensible.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kathy Drayton, Lucia Salinas Briones, Jackie Farkas and AFTRS

results.title: Saturn's return
results.creator_credit: Wenona Byrne, Helen Pankhurst and Christos Tsiolkas
results.brief_description: ‘Saturn’s return’ is part of an SBS commissioned series called ‘Hybrid Life’, which explores the experience of second and third generation migrants. Barney and his lover Dimi set out on a road trip to visit Barney’s father who is dying of AIDS and has decided to end his life. Based on a short story by Christos Tsiolkas and directed by Wenona Byrne, the film uses the road movie journey as a means to travel through Australia’s chequered history, while the two lovers confront their families turbulent past.

results.title: New dance
results.brief_description: Several short pieces in which individuals or groups of dancers work with the idea of ‘minimal choreography’, using simple props such as balls, rods and firesticks to create complicated patterns and rhythms from a few basic movements. The result is a quirky hybrid of circus skills and dance, augmented by some image manipulation in the edit suite.
